record.title: HONORING RICHARD JOHNSON, JR.
record.narrative:
HONORING RICHARD JOHNSON, JR. -- (House of Representatives - February 25, 2008)

[Page: H1017]
(Mr. BARRETT of South Carolina asked and was given permission to address the House for 1 minute.)

speaking.paragraph: Madam Speaker, community volunteers run our school boards, our civil centers, help with youth programs, and assist our hospitals. They make a difference to so many and ask for nothing more than an opportunity to give.

Richard Johnson, Jr., is not your average community volunteer, and during Black History Month, I would like to honor him for his dedication to service. A community activist and well-known civil volunteer, Richard has devoted his spare time to promote education, health care, and politics around the Aiken area.
He is not only a volunteer to his region, he has also served his Nation in the United States Army and is a member of the Korean War Veterans Association.
Each of the boards Richard serves, councils he governs, and committees he chairs, bears the benefit of his knowledge, commitment, and experience.
During this month, our Third District of South Carolina recognizes the true community service of Richard Johnson, Jr., and I proudly thank him for those he has served in his State and in his Nation.
